availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin R. Hester (Todd Co, Ky, minister and prov govt)

body.p: Todd County, Kentucky, Methodist Minister and provisional government convention member. North Carolina native. Married to Margaret H. Henry Hester in Sumner County, Tennessee, on December 7, 1840. Father of Moses H. Hester, George M.D. Hester, John B. Hester, and L.A. Hester. Methodist Minister in Todd County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Todd Couny in 1850. Methodist minister in Todd County in 1860. Owned fifteen enslaved persons in Todd County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in 1861.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, p. 809.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, p. 369B.
Tennessee Marriage Records, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Tennessee, 1840-1849: Marriages (Loose Rec) A-P.
KYR-0004-033-0001.
